citations.narrative:
There is still a section of exposed landscaping mesh fabric in the outdoor portion of one enclosure. This was observed in
a sloped area of the yard, where the gravel was not completely covering the underlying landscape material. The
enclosure housed 8 puppies, some of which were observed chewing on the frayed edges of the material. This could
cause injury to the puppies if they were to become entangled in the frayed areas. In addition, the puppies could become ill
if the material was to be ingested. Primary enclosures must be kept in good repair to protect the animals from injury.

At the time of the inspection, one automatic water nipple was not working and there was no water available for a female
with three puppies. When she was given fresh water, she began to drink nonstop for almost two minutes straight. She
paused and then again began to drink again. Based on the eagerness for consuming water it is not known when she last
had access to water. Dogs must have continuous access to water for their health and well being and this is especially
important for nursing mothers. Although a bucket of water was provided at the time of the inspection, the facility must
ensure that the dogs have continuous access to water for their health.
Correct by: June 19, 2025

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The outdoor runs are not being spot cleaned daily and there is an accumulation of feces in the runs. Primary enclosures
must be spot cleaned daily, and feces removed to keep the areas clean and to prevent the dogs from becoming soiled.
Correct by: June 19, 2025

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The stainless-steel water buckets anchored to the wall under the automatic water drinkers are dirty and need to be
cleaned. Not only are they holding water not consumed by the dogs, but there is excess fur and dirt in the buckets. These
water receptacles need to be cleaned on a routine basis and at least once every two weeks per this regulation for the
health of the dogs.
Correct by: June 25, 2025

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Housekeeping around the kennel and primary enclosures need to be addressed. In one empty outdoor run, there is an
excess of weeds and grass growth throughout the area. Excess weeds can create breeding and living areas for pests
right next to the enclosures. Weeds, grasses, and bushes must be controlled so as to facilitate cleaning of the premises
and pest control, and to protect the health and well-being of the animals.
Correct by: June 25, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.6(a)(1)  Repeat
   
Primary enclosures. 
There is still a section of exposed landscaping mesh fabric in the outdoor portion of one enclosure. This was observed in 
a sloped area of the yard, where the gravel was not completely covering the underlying landscape material. The 
enclosure housed 8 puppies, some of which were observed chewing on the frayed edges of the material. This could 
cause injury to the puppies if they were to become entangled in the frayed areas. In addition, the puppies could become ill 
if the material was to be ingested. Primary enclosures must be kept in good repair to protect the animals from injury. 
3.10(a)  Direct
   
Watering 
At the time of the inspection, one automatic water nipple was not working and there was no water available for a female 
with three puppies. When she was given fresh water, she began to drink nonstop for almost two minutes straight. She 
paused and then again began to drink again. Based on the eagerness for consuming water it is not known when she last 
had access to water. Dogs must have continuous access to water for their health and well being and this is especially 
important for nursing mothers. Although a bucket of water was provided at the time of the inspection, the facility must 
ensure that the dogs have continuous access to water for their health.  
Correct by: June 19, 2025 
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The outdoor runs are not being spot cleaned daily and there is an accumulation of feces in the runs. Primary enclosures 
must be spot cleaned daily, and feces removed to keep the areas clean and to prevent the dogs from becoming soiled.  
Correct by: June 19, 2025 
3.11(b)(2) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The stainless-steel water buckets anchored to the wall under the automatic water drinkers are dirty and need to be 
cleaned. Not only are they holding water not consumed by the dogs, but there is excess fur and dirt in the buckets. These 
water receptacles need to be cleaned on a routine basis and at least once every two weeks per this regulation for the

health of the dogs.  
Correct by: June 25, 2025 
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Housekeeping around the kennel and primary enclosures need to be addressed. In one empty outdoor run, there is an 
excess of weeds and grass growth throughout the area. Excess weeds can create breeding and living areas for pests 
right next to the enclosures. Weeds, grasses, and bushes must be controlled so as to facilitate cleaning of the premises 
and pest control, and to protect the health and well-being of the animals. 
 
Correct by: June 25, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
